IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: The mission of DeSales University is to provide men and women with quality higher education according to the philosophy of Christian humanism as developed by Saint Francis de Sales and his spiritual heirs.
IRS990.MissionDescription: It is the mission of DeSales University to provide men and women with quality higher education according to the philosophy of Christian humanism as developed by Saint Francis de Sales and his spiritual heirs.
IRS990.Description: Higher Education: Educational institution providing men and women with an Oblate Catholic liberal arts education through its undergraduate and graduate accredited degree programs. (2,387 FTE)

Form990PartVIISectionA.NamePerson: V Rev Joseph G Morrissey OSFS
Form990PartVIISectionA.Title: Trustee

Form990PartVIISectionA.NamePerson: V Rev Bernard O Connor OSFS
Form990PartVIISectionA.Title: President

OtherLiabilities.Description: Net unamortized debt premium and discount

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Paintings and sculptures are maintained and used by the theatre and arts programs for class instructional purposes.
Funds from the University's subsidiary are held and invested with the University's Endowment Funds.
The University's endowments consist of various funds established for a variety of purposes such as scholarships and operating program support.
The University has concluded that there are no material unrecognized tax benefits or accrued interest or penalties.
Amount represents the change in value of split-interest agreements, subsidiary operations, and loss on debt refinancing.
Cost of goods sold for the bookstore and printery operations, subsidiary operations, change in value of split interest agreements, and loss on debt refinancing.

Adjusting for PHEAA and PELL grants which are excluded from revenue under financial accounting standards and adding back scholarship allowances which are reported as net revenue for the audited financial statements.
Cost of goods sold for the University's bookstore and printery operations, and elimination of a donation to the PA Shakespeare Festival.
Adjustments for Federal Pell Grants, PHEAA Grants and financial aid allowances.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: All solicitations include disclosure of nondiscrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, handicap, or veteran status in the administration of educational admissions and employment policies.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: During the fiscal year ended June 30, 2010, the University received financial aid and assistance in the following forms: Federal Pell Grants, Federal Work Study Program, Federal Supplemental Educational Opportunity Grants, Academic Competitiveness Grants, National Science and Mathematics Access to Retain Talent Grants, Federal Perkins Loans, PHEAA State Grants, Pennsylvania Institutional Assistance Grant, U.S. Department of Health & Human Services Nursing Student Loans and Nurse Faculty Loan Programs, and Federal Direct Student Loans.

AcctsActvsOutUSTable.SpecificServicesProvided: DeSales University in partnership with the Romanian-American University offers an American MBA Program in Project Management.

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.TypeOfGrant: PA Higher Education Assistance Agency Grant
National Science and Mathematics Access to Retain Talent Grants

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Scholarships are awarded on the basis of academic achievement while grants are awarded on the basis of finacial need, academic achievement, and other similar standards as designated by the U.S. department of Education.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: A social club membership is paid by the University for the President to conduct University business. The Vice-President of Institutional Advancement's social club membership is partially paid by the University in order to conduct University business.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: Trustee for University and President/CEO of Keystone Nazareth Bank & Trust/National Penn Bank
Trustee for University & VP of Orlando Diefenderfer Electrical Contractors

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The University is organized as a not-for-profit corporation. The corporation is governed by the Board of Trustees.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Form 990 was reviewed by the members of the Audit Committee.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Officers, trustees, and employees with purchasing, financial, and budgetary responsibilities receive the Conflict of Interest Policy annually and are asked to acknowledge receipt and compliance with the policy by signing the document and disclosing conflicts.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The University's Board of Trustees approve compensation for officers and top management.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The University's governing documents, conflicts of interest policy, and financial statements are made available to the public upon request.
